column1: CMOR Table cfMon: CFMIP Monthly-Mean Cloud Diagnostic Fields
For further guidance, please see http://www.cfmip.net
The spread sheet "CFMIP output" specifies the simulations and time-periods for which the cloud diagnostic fields listed on this spread sheet should be saved.
In CMOR Table cfMon: "CFMIP monthly 3D"--monthly mean 3-D fields on model levels (or half levels in the case of fluxes)

column2: long name
column4: comment

column2: Upwelling Longwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Downwelling Longwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Upwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
column4: Include also the fluxes at the surface and TOA.

column2: Air Temperature
Tendency of Air Temperature
Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection
Tendency of Air Temperature due to Diabatic Processes
Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Tendency of Air Temperature due to Radiative Heating
Tendency of Air Temperature due to Moist Convection
Specific Humidity
Tendency of Specific Humidity
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Convection
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Diffusion
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Stratiform Cloud Condensation and Evaporation
Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Model Physics
column4: This should include sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. convection, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.) and should exclude sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and diffusion.

column2: Eddy Viscosity Coefficients for Momentum
Eddy Diffusivity Coefficients for Temperature
Convective Cloud Area Fraction
Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
column4: Calculate as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

column2: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
column4: Calculate as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

column2: Stratiform Cloud Area Fraction
Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
column4: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

column2: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
column4: Calculate as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  Include precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

column2: Updraft Convective Mass Flux
column4: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).   Calculate as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

column2: Downdraft Convective Mass Flux
column4: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).  Calculate as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

column2: Shallow Convective Mass Flux
column4: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).   The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, calculate as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

column2: Deep Convective Mass Flux
column4: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).  The net mass flux should represent the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   Calculate as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Condensation and Evaporation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water Due to Convective Detrainment
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Homogeneous Nucleation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Heterogeneous Nucleation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Riming
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Accretion to Rain
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Accretion to Snow
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Melting From Cloud Ice
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Autoconversion
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water due to Advection
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice Due Convective Detrainment
column4: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice Due to Convective Detrainment

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Homogeneous Nucleation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Heterogeneous Nucleation From Cloud Liquid
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Heterogeneous Nucleation From Water Vapor
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Riming From Cloud Liquid
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Riming From Rain
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Deposition and Sublimation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Aggregation
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Accretion to Snow
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Evaporation of Melting Ice
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Melting to Rain
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Melting to Cloud Liquid
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Icefall
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice due to Advection
Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Condensation and Evaporation
column4: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Autoconversion to Rain
column4: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Autoconversion to Snow
column4: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Icefall
column4: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

column2: Tendency of Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Condensed Water due to Advection
column4: condensed water includes both liquid and ice.

column1: In CMOR Table cfMon: "CFMIP monthly 4xCO2 2D" -- monthly mean 2D TOA radiative fluxes  calculated by instantaneously quadrupling CO2.

column2: long name
column4: comment

column2: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation in 4XCO2 Atmosphere
TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere

column1: In CMOR Table cfMon: "CFMIP monthly 4xCO2 3D" -- monthly mean 3-D radiative fluxes  calculated by instantaneously quadrupling CO2. On model half levels, including the surface and the Top of the Atmosphere.

column2: long name
column4: comment

column2: Upwelling Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Upwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Downwelling Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Downwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Upwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere

column1: In CMOR Table cfMon: "CFMIP monthly inline" -- monthly mean in line ISCCP and CALIPSO/PARASOL simulator output

column2: long name
column4: comment

column2: ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction
ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo
column4: When computing time-means, weight by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  http://www.cfmip.net/README

column2: ISCCP Mean Cloud Top Pressure
column4: When computing time-means, weight by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction - see  http://www.cfmip.net/README

column2: ISCCP Cloud Area Fraction
column4: 7 levels x 7 tau

column2: CALIPSO Total Cloud Fraction
CALIPSO Low Level Cloud Fraction
CALIPSO Mid Level Cloud Fraction
CALIPSO High Level Cloud Fraction
CALIPSO Cloud Fraction
column4: 40 height levels

column2: PARASOL Reflectance
column4: 5 bins of solar zenith angle.  This is reflectance as seen at the top of the atmosphere.
